page.title: 19 TOURISM
page.content: HIGHGATE VILLAGE is at the top of Highgate Hill and is one of the best remaining examples in London of an 18th Century village.Many of the buildings are Georgian paticularly around the Green and Pond Square. The Grove is a fine example of a Georgian Terrace.Samuel Taylor Coleridge lived at No 3.There are some notable houses including Lauderdale House and Widanhurst. HIGHGATE CEMETERY can be found nearby. This famous 19th Century cemetery was landscaped to seem more like a country walk than a graveyard.Designed to take the overspill from graveyards in London it contains some famous people including Christina Rosetti,George Eliot and Michael Faraday.Many people go to the new part of the cemetery to see the monument to Karl Marx,the political and economic philosopher.
